filetype_list.description:
List of filetypes
To refer to all filetypes, use [ALL]

linter_list.description:
List of linter IDs
To refer to all linters, use [ALL]

template_string.description: String where "${key1} ${key2}" will be expanded into "value1 value2"

description: The last linter you'll ever need

allow_empty_files.description: Whether or not this will be run on empty files

batch.description:
Whether linter invocations for multiple targets should be batched; used to cut down on per-invocation overhead

Causes every token containing ${target} to be expanded multiple times, e.g. 'my_linter target=${target}' would be expanded into 'my_linter target=target1 target=target2 ... target=targetN'

cache_results.description: Whether Trunk can cache results for this linter

command.description: argv of the command to invoke the linter with

allow_empty_files.description: Whether or not this will be run on empty files

batch.description:
Whether linter invocations for multiple targets should be batched; used to cut down on per-invocation overhead

Causes every token containing ${target} to be expanded multiple times, e.g. 'my_linter target=${target}' would be expanded into 'my_linter target=target1 target=target2 ... target=targetN'

cache_results.description: Whether Trunk can cache results for this linter

disable_upstream.description: Whether or not we support linting the upstream version of a target

enabled.description: Whether the command is enabled to run when the linter is run. Allows some commands of a linter to be run by default without others.

error_codes.description: Exit codes implying the linter experienced an internal error

formatter.description: Whether or not this linter will be run by 'trunk fmt'; default: false

in_place.description: Whether the linter modifies ${target} files in-place.

output.description: Output type of this linter; controls how `trunk` parses its output

prepare_run.description: Command to initialize the linter with

read_output_from.description:
Tell parser where to expect output from for reading (if 'tmpfile', then the linter should write its output to ${tmpfile})

NOTE: this field is only respected for type=sarif linters currently

run.description: Command to invoke the linter with (write as if you were typing into your shell)
examples: "${linter}" will expand to the directory a linter is installed into, e.g. "${linter}/node_modules/.bin" is appended to the `PATH` of any linter with `runtime: node`
"${runtime}" will expand to the directory a runtime is installed into, e.g. with `runtime: node`, "${runtime}/bin/npm" will yield the path to the installed NPM binary
"${linter}" will expand to the directory a linter is installed into, e.g. "${linter}/node_modules/.bin" is appended to the `PATH` of any linter with `runtime: node`
"${runtime}" will expand to the directory a runtime is installed into, e.g. with `runtime: node`, "${runtime}/bin/npm" will yield the path to the installed NPM binary

run_from_root_target.description: The nearest target to search for when 'run_linter_from' is 'root_file' or 'root_directory'

run_linter_from.description:
What to use as the current working directory:
  * workspace - the root of the repository
  * parent_directory - the directory containing the linter target
  * directory - the linter target itself, with the condition that the linter target is a directory itself
  * root_file - the nearest directory containing 'run_from_root_target', e.g. the nearest directory containing a go.mod file
  * root_directory - the nearest directory matching 'run_from_root_target', e.g. the nearest src/ directory

std_in.description: Whether or not this linter takes its input from stdin

success_codes.description: Exit codes corresponding to no issues found or issues found

disable_upstream.description: Whether or not we support linting the upstream version of a target

download.description: The download containing this linter (i.e. the `name` of an entry in `downloads`)

enabled.description: Whether the command is enabled to run when the linter is run. Allows some commands of a linter to be run by default without others.

environment.description: Environment variables set when `trunk` runs the linter

list.description: The envvar will be set to the `:`-joined list

examples: "${linter}" will expand to the directory a linter is installed into, e.g. "${linter}/node_modules/.bin" is appended to the `PATH` of any linter with `runtime: node`
"${runtime}" will expand to the directory a runtime is installed into, e.g. with `runtime: node`, "${runtime}/bin/npm" will yield the path to the installed NPM binary
"${linter}" will expand to the directory a linter is installed into, e.g. "${linter}/node_modules/.bin" is appended to the `PATH` of any linter with `runtime: node`
"${runtime}" will expand to the directory a runtime is installed into, e.g. with `runtime: node`, "${runtime}/bin/npm" will yield the path to the installed NPM binary

error_codes.description: Exit codes implying the linter experienced an internal error

extra_packages.description: Extra packages needed to run this linter; also installed using the runtime's package manager

files.description: Filetypes to run this linter on

formatter.description: Whether or not this linter will be run by 'trunk fmt'; default: false

in_place.description: Whether the linter modifies ${target} files in-place.

include_lfs.description: Whether or not this linter can handle LFS files; default: false

name.description: Linter ID; use this in fields like `enabled` to reference this linter

package.description: The package containing this linter; installed using the runtime's package manager

prepare_command.description: argv of the command to initialize the linter with

read_output_from.description:
Tell parser where to expect output from for reading (if 'tmpfile', then the linter should write its output to ${tmpfile})

NOTE: this field is only respected for type=sarif linters currently

run_from_root_target.description: The nearest target to search for when 'run_linter_from' is 'root_file' or 'root_directory'

run_linter_from.description:
What to use as the current working directory:
  * workspace - the root of the repository
  * parent_directory - the directory containing the linter target
  * directory - the linter target itself, with the condition that the linter target is a directory itself
  * root_file - the nearest directory containing 'run_from_root_target', e.g. the nearest directory containing a go.mod file
  * root_directory - the nearest directory matching 'run_from_root_target', e.g. the nearest src/ directory

runtime.description: The runtime, toolchain, and package manager used to run and install a linter

std_in.description: Whether or not this linter takes its input from stdin

success_codes.description: Exit codes corresponding to no issues found or issues found

type.description: Output type of this linter; controls how `trunk` parses its output

oneOf.description: linter@envOrVersion, where envOrVersion is either the name of an environment, the version of the main `package` if `runtime` is set, or the verson of the `download`
Name of tools to enable, including a version. If a tool shares a name with an enabled linter, it can be omitted from this list.

items.description: List of runtimes to enable for tools - must also be enabled in top level runtimes section

version.description: The trunk config version being parsed. The only possible value is 0.1.

title: Configuration schema for trunk, a powerful linter runner - https://docs.trunk.io
